root.speaker: Jordan
root.text: Yo. I made pasta. There's extra if you want. Also I learned to juggle today. Wanna see?

choices.text: You learned to JUGGLE? Show me immediately.
choices.internal_monologue: (Jordan drops all three oranges within 4 seconds. You both laugh for 2 minutes straight. This is the best ratio of effort to joy you'll experience in your entire life. You'll never optimize for it because it can't be optimized.)

choices.text: Can't right now, I have to prep for a test. Rain check?
choices.internal_monologue: (Jordan shrugs. Jordan always shrugs. Jordan's life is a series of shrugs that somehow feel more honest than all your planning.)

choices.text: Juggling? Shouldn't you be studying? You have finals too.
choices.internal_monologue: (You just sounded exactly like the worst version of yourself. Jordan knows it too. The look they give you is the look you'll eventually see in a mirror in Act IV.)

jordan_juggle.speaker: Jordan
jordan_juggle.text: WAIT WAIT I almost— nope. Okay one more try. ...Nope. You know what, juggling is overrated. Wanna just eat pasta and watch something dumb?

choices.internal_monologue: (You watch 3 episodes of a show about people who think they can sing but can't. Jordan does commentary. You eat too much pasta. Your phone buzzes with a study group text. You ignore it. This is the correct choice and you'll never be rewarded for it.)

choices.text: I should actually get back to studying. But the juggling was great.
choices.internal_monologue: (Jordan says 'no worries!' and means it. Jordan always means it. That's the difference between you two and you're not sure which side is better.)

jordan_shrug.speaker: Jordan
jordan_shrug.text: Yeah sure. Hey — you're like, really stressed lately. You know that, right? Like... MORE stressed than normal. And your normal is already a lot.

choices.text: I'm fine. This is just how it is right now.
choices.internal_monologue: ('Fine' is doing the heaviest lifting of any 4-letter word in the English language.)

choices.text: ...Yeah. I know. I don't know how to stop though.
choices.internal_monologue: (Jordan doesn't try to fix it. Doesn't offer advice. Just says 'that sucks.' It's the most helpful thing anyone has said to you in weeks.)

jordan_hurt.speaker: Jordan
jordan_hurt.text: ...Wow. Okay. I'm gonna go eat my pasta in my room. Have fun being you.

choices.internal_monologue: (They're already gone. The door closes with exactly the right amount of pressure to communicate 'I'm not slamming it but I want you to know I could.' Sibling door physics are an art form.)

jordan_honest.speaker: Jordan
jordan_honest.text: You know what I think? I think you're scared that if you stop for even a second, you'll fall behind. But behind what? Like... behind WHO?

choices.text: ...I don't know. Everyone? The idea of where I should be?
choices.internal_monologue: (Jordan just asked the second most important question in this game. The first is 'was it worth it?' You won't get to that one for a while.)

choices.text: It's not that simple, Jordan. You wouldn't understand.
choices.internal_monologue: (Jordan understands perfectly. That's what terrifies you.)
